solution_line_template: One garden bed measures {bed_length}ft long, {bed_width}ft wide and {bed_height}ft high so to find the cubic feet needed, {bed_length}*{bed_width}*{bed_height} = <<{bed_length}*{bed_width}*{bed_height}={cubic_feet_per_bed}>>{cubic_feet_per_bed} cubic feet of soil needed
Both beds are the same size so she needs {num_beds}*{cubic_feet_per_bed} = <<{num_beds}*{cubic_feet_per_bed}={total_cubic_feet_needed}>>{total_cubic_feet_needed} cubic feet of soil

Every bag has {cubic_feet_per_bag} cubic feet of soil and she needs {total_cubic_feet_needed} cubic feet so {total_cubic_feet_needed}/{cubic_feet_per_bag} = <<{total_cubic_feet_needed}/{cubic_feet_per_bag}={total_bags_needed}>>{total_bags_needed} bags needed
